intro: Dactylorhiza traunsteineri var. mielichhoferi, commonly known as the Traunsteiner’s orchid, is a rare and endangered orchid species native to parts of Europe. It is a terrestrial herb with a slender, upright stem and a single, showy flower that typically blooms in late spring. The plant has a complex root system and is adapted to grow in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and heathlands. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, with a distinctive lip that is often marked with intricate patterns. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
